general_city_data.attractions: Prado Museum, Reina Sofia Museum, Royal Palace of Madrid, Retiro Park, Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Temple of Debod, Gran Vía, Santiago Bernabéu Stadium.
general_city_data.description: Madrid, the vibrant capital of Spain, is a city that seamlessly blends historical grandeur with modern energy. Known for its stunning architecture, world-class art museums like the Prado and Reina Sofia, and lively atmosphere, Madrid offers a rich cultural experience. From the bustling Puerta del Sol to the serene Retiro Park, the city provides a diverse range of attractions. Indulge in delicious tapas, explore the Royal Palace, or catch a passionate flamenco performance. Madrid's warm and welcoming spirit makes it a truly unforgettable destination.
general_city_data.history: Madrid's history dates back to the 9th century when it was a Moorish fortress. It became the capital of Spain in the 16th century under Philip II, marking the beginning of its golden age. The city has played a significant role in Spanish history, witnessing numerous political and social changes, including the Spanish Civil War. Today, Madrid stands as a modern metropolis with a rich historical heritage.
general_city_data.timezone: Central European Time (CET) / Central European Summer Time (CEST)
general_city_data.weather: Madrid has a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and cool, wet winters. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures.

itinerary_response.itinerary_name: Madrid Tapas & Treasures: A Flexible Exploration
itinerary_response.overall_description: This itinerary offers a flexible exploration of Madrid, focusing on experiencing authentic tapas culture and uncovering hidden gems. With no strict timing, you can adjust the pace to your liking. It balances iconic landmarks with local experiences, allowing for spontaneous discoveries within a 5km radius. This itinerary caters to all budgets, providing options for affordable tapas bars and free activities. Enjoy the vibrant atmosphere of Madrid at your own speed!
